channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Obstruction of Public Highway – Use of Cones to Reserve Parking Space, 18th November
item.description:
I’d like to report an ongoing issue on Elstree Gardens regarding the use of cones to reserve a parking space on the public road. My neighbours have a private driveway, which they are currently renting out through a parking app. At the same time, they are placing a traffic cone on the public highway outside the property to “reserve” an on-street parking space for their own use. As the parking on this road is public and first-come-first-served, the cone is obstructing other residents from using the space. Additionally, during the recent windy weather, the cone was blown into the road and became a hazard for vehicles passing through.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Elstree Gardens, Lessness Heath, Erith, London Borough of Bexley
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Traffic light still having the wrong way, 18th November
item.description:
The traffic light outside cobalt square facing the traffic coming through the tunnel is still facing the wrong way and hasn’t been fixed since the last report. Cars are repeatedly going through a red light, endangering pedestrians
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Arch 56, South Lambeth Road, Vauxhall, London Borough of Lambeth

item.title: Large unsightly graffiti sprayed into a wall, 18th November
item.description:
There appears to be a worrying increase in graffiti in the borough recently. We have removed similar graffiti from our own property. This is right opposite a school and clearly visible and needs removing. Thank you

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hayes Lane, Hayes, Bromley, London Borough of Bromley
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Blocked drains, 18th November
item.description:
I reported blocked drains on Durham Rd which causes flooding when it rains. Today two men attended and spent about 5 minutes (max) kicking around a few leaves and the left. Then I get an email saying that the issue is resolved when there has been absolutely no attempt to even try and unblock the drains!!!! THESE DRAINS HAVE BEEN BLOCKED FOR YEARS!!!!! Please sort this out.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Durham Road, Shortlands, Bromley, London Borough of Bromley
Report on FixMyStreet
